availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Ohio.
City of Cincinnati } ss:

Samuel S. Carpenter. a Commissioner of deeds. &c. duly appointed and commissioned by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, under the laws thereof, to execute the duties of his office within the state of Ohio, -- by Commission dated October 23rd, 1861, being duly sworn, makes oath, that he will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of his station as such Commission.
Sworn to and subscribed before me, a Notary Public in and for the County of Hamilton and State of Ohio, duly commissioned and authorized to administer oaths, this 26th day of October, A.D., 1861.
Witness my hand and official seal.

Cyrus Knowlton.
Notary Public. Ham. Co. O.

Ohio
Comr. of Deeds
S. S. Carpenter
Oath.
Filed Octo 30. 1861
